name: Spaghetti with Tuna and Capers
author: Kim's Cooking Now
summary: With a few simple ingredients, you can have a delicious meal! My husband came up with this recipe while we are on "stay at home" orders due to the Coronavirus pandemic. It was quick, easy, and delicious!
ingredients: 1 (5 ounce) can tuna packed in olive oil, undrained
¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat
Add onion and cook until beginning to caramelize, about 10 minutes
Add tuna with oil, capers, and crushed red pepper flakes; heat through
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water for 1 minute less than the package instructs, about 10 minutes
Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the starchy pasta water
Add the cooked pasta to the pan and mix to combine
Add some of the pasta water and toss lightly until the pasta is tender yet firm to the bite, 1 to 2 more minutes
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately
